name: mpb

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
MPB is a free and open-source software package for computing
electromagnetic band structures and modes.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Lightweight but flexible shim designed to rectify the incompatibilities
between the Accelerate/vecLib BLAS and LAPACK libraries shipped with
macOS and FORTRAN code compiled with modern compilers such as GNU
Fortran.

dependencies.name: fftw-api
dependencies.description:
Arm Compiler combines the optimized tools and libraries from Arm with a
modern LLVM-based compiler framework.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: guile
dependencies.description:
Guile is the GNU Ubiquitous Intelligent Language for Extensions, the
official extension language for the GNU operating system.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: libctl
dependencies.description:
libctl is a free Guile-based library implementing flexible control files
for scientific simulations.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependent_to.name: meep
dependent_to.description:
Meep (or MEEP) is a free finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) simulation
software package developed at MIT to model electromagnetic systems.
